The recovery of Berwick was almost immediately followed by an unsuccessful attempt to acquire Carlisle. That border town, which was held for Edward IV„ was laid siege to by a Scottish army; but the siege, in which the Scots are said to have lost six thousand men, was raised by Lord Montagu, events alluded to in a letter which cannot have been written later than May 1461.5
